TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class JavascriptInterface : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Lang.Annotation.IAnnotation

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit JavascriptInterface extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Lang.Annotation.IAnnotation, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Annotation that allows exposing methods to JavaScript.

remarks.para: Annotation that allows exposing methods to JavaScript. Starting from API level and above, only methods explicitly marked with this annotation are available to the Javascript code. See for more information about it.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
